fields.summary: Cannot build app with 3.2-beta - CLI version set at 3.1.2
fields.environment:
MacBook Pro running OSX 10.9

Titanium Studio info:
Titanium Studio, build: 3.2.1.201311271927
(c) Copyright 2012-2013 by Appcelerator, Inc.  All rights reserved.
 
Build: jenkins-titanium-rcp-release-58 (origin/release)
Date: 27 November 2013, 19:28:01

comments.body: To update CLI to 3.2.0, please run "sudo npm install -g titanium@3.2.0-beta".

Ran the update and then ran the status command - CLI is still at version 3.1.2. Here's the output from the status command:
{panel}
terminalprompt# sudo titanium status
Password:
Titanium Command-Line Interface, CLI version 3.1.2, Titanium SDK version 3.2.0.v20131127194046
{panel}
I am having to enter the titanium commands with sudo in order to get them to work - is this correct or is there an installation issue?

No, you should only need to install titanium with sudo, but afterwards that's not necessary. It sounds as if you may have an installation issue. Can you uninstall and reinstall the titanium node package?
